description: Retrieves information about a bulk import job request. For more information, see Describe a bulk import job (CLI) in the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide.

nested_items.name: jobId
nested_items.description: The ID of the job.

nested_items.name: jobName
nested_items.description: The unique name that helps identify the job request.

nested_items.name: jobStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the bulk import job can be one of following values:
PENDING --- IoT SiteWise is waiting for the current bulk import job to finish.
CANCELLED --- The bulk import job has been canceled.
RUNNING --- IoT SiteWise is processing your request to import your data from Amazon S3.
COMPLETED --- IoT SiteWise successfully completed your request to import data from Amazon S3.
FAILED --- IoT SiteWise couldn't process your request to import data from Amazon S3. You can use logs saved in the specified error report location in Amazon S3 to troubleshoot issues.

COMPLETED_WITH_FAILURES --- IoT SiteWise completed your request to import data from Amazon S3 with errors. You can use logs saved in the specified error report location in Amazon S3 to troubleshoot issues.

nested_items.name: jobRoleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that allows IoT SiteWise to read Amazon S3 data.

nested_items.name: files
nested_items.description: The files in the specified Amazon S3 bucket that contain your data.

nested_items.name: bucket
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket from which data is imported.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The key of the Amazon S3 object that contains your data. Each object has a key that is a unique identifier. Each object has exactly one key.

nested_items.name: versionId
nested_items.description: The version ID to identify a specific version of the Amazon S3 object that contains your data.

nested_items.name: errorReportLocation
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 destination where errors associated with the job creation request are saved.

nested_items.name: bucket
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket to which errors associated with the bulk import job are sent.

nested_items.name: prefix
nested_items.description: Amazon S3 uses the prefix as a folder name to organize data in the bucket. Each Amazon S3 object has a key that is its unique identifier in the bucket. Each object in a bucket has exactly one key. The prefix must end with a forward slash (/). For more information, see Organizing objects using prefixes in the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide.

nested_items.name: jobConfiguration
nested_items.description: Contains the configuration information of a job, such as the file format used to save data in Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: fileFormat
nested_items.description: The file format of the data in S3.

nested_items.name: columnNames
nested_items.description: The column names specified in the .csv file.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: jobCreationDate
nested_items.description: The date the job was created, in Unix epoch TIME.

nested_items.name: jobLastUpdateDate
nested_items.description: The date the job was last updated, in Unix epoch time.

nested_items.name: adaptiveIngestion
nested_items.description: If set to true, ingest new data into IoT SiteWise storage. Measurements with notifications, metrics and transforms are computed. If set to false, historical data is ingested into IoT SiteWise as is.

nested_items.name: deleteFilesAfterImport
nested_items.description: If set to true, your data files is deleted from S3, after ingestion into IoT SiteWise storage.
